intro: Willdenowia fistulosa, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Willdenowia fistulosa is typically found in moist, shady habitats such as forest understories.
